protocol_field.name: Hello Packet
protocol_field.description: Periodically sent on all interfaces to establish and maintain neighbor relationships. Includes parameters for neighbor relationship validation.

fields.name: Version #
constraints: Value must correspond to the OSPF version in use.

fields.name: Packet length
fields.description: The length of the OSPF packet in bytes, including the header.
constraints: Must be greater than or equal to the minimum size of the Hello packet.

fields.name: Router ID
fields.description: The identifier of the router originating the packet.
constraints: Must be a unique 32-bit value within the OSPF domain.

fields.name: Area ID
fields.description: The identifier of the OSPF area to which the packet belongs.
constraints: Must match the area ID of the interface sending the packet.

fields.name: Checksum
fields.description: A checksum of the entire OSPF packet for error detection.
constraints: Calculated using the standard OSPF checksum algorithm.

fields.name: AuType
fields.description: The type of authentication used for the packet.
constraints: 0 means no authentication, 1 means simple password, 2 means cryptographic authentication.

fields.name: Authentication
fields.description: Authentication data, usage depends on the AuType field.
constraints: If AuType is 0, this field is unused; if AuType is 1, contains a simple password; if AuType is 2, contains cryptographic data.

fields.name: Network Mask
fields.description: The subnet mask associated with the interface.
constraints: For example, 0xffffff00 for a class B network with subnetting in the third byte.

fields.name: HelloInterval
fields.description: The interval in seconds between Hello packets sent by the router.
constraints: Must be agreed upon by all routers on the same network.

fields.name: Options
fields.description: Optional capabilities supported by the router.
constraints: Defined in Section A.2 of the RFC document.

fields.name: Rtr Pri
fields.description: The priority of the router for (Backup) Designated Router election.
constraints: 0 makes the router ineligible for (Backup) Designated Router role.

fields.name: RouterDeadInterval
fields.description: The time in seconds before declaring a silent router down.
constraints: Must be consistent across all routers on the same network.

fields.name: Designated Router
fields.description: The IP address of the Designated Router for the network.
constraints: Set to 0.0.0.0 if no Designated Router exists.

fields.name: Backup Designated Router
fields.description: The IP address of the Backup Designated Router for the network.
constraints: Set to 0.0.0.0 if no Backup Designated Router exists.

fields.name: Neighbor
fields.description: The Router IDs of neighboring routers from whom valid Hello packets have been received recently.
constraints: Each entry is a 32-bit Router ID.
Listed neighbors must have sent Hello packets within the last RouterDeadInterval seconds.

comments: This JSON template describes the structure of the OSPF Hello packet fields based on the provided RFC section.
